MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Primary Schools Class Sizes.

Qst.Quest: her response to the recent OECD report which showed that Ireland had the largest primary school classes in Europe and the second largest in the developed world; the additional resources, if any, she intends to allocate to ensure that Irish children do not suffer an educational disadvantage by significantly reducing class sizes; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: I assume that the Deputy is referring to the report “Education at a Glance” published by the OECD in December, 1993. For most countries, including Ireland, the data published in the report relates to the 1990-91 school year.

The average class size in Irish primary schools in 1990-91 was 30.3. However, this has fallen to 29.6 for the 1991-92 school year, the latest year for which statistics are available. In addition, the recorded pupil/teacher ratio for Ireland in 1990-91 was 26.6:1. The PTR has been significantly reduced in each subsequent, year and currently stands at 24.2:1.

It is estimated that the average class size at present is close to 29. This of course is an average and many classes are above or below the average. With a view to reducing class sizes further the Programme for Partnership Government provides that the pupil/teacher ratio in primary schools will be reduced to 22 to 1 by September 1996. My Department is currently examining the question of class sizes and the guidelines currently in operation at primary level.

Qst.Quest: the consideration, if any, she is giving to a request for additional classrooms for St. Mary's Primary School, Ballyhaise, County Cavan; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: My Department is investigating the need for an additional classroom for St. Mary's Primary School, Ballyhaise, Co. Cavan. A decision will be conveyed to the Chairman in due course.

Qst.Quest: the arrangements, if any, she is making for proper inservice training for the transition year, vocational leaving certificate and applied leaving certificate programmes; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Breathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: In the case of transition year, I have arranged for an in-career development programme to be delivered at regional level by a team of experienced teachers who have been trained specifically for the task. The programme involves briefing the whole staff of schools offering transition year and includes two days of in-career development at local level for groups of 4/5 teachers from each school.

With regard to the Leaving Certificate vocational programme and the Leaving Certificate applied programme, I propose to put in place a comprehensive training programme of in-career development for the teachers involved.

Qst.Quest: if it is her Department's policy to withhold the full staffing requirement of permanent teachers in community and comprehensive schools even where these schools have the requisite numbers to warrant the appointment of permanent teachers; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: The staffing approved in any one year is expressed in whole-time teacher equivalent units. While the greater part of the staffing allocation is used to make permanent whole-time appointments, some of the allocation may be used only to make temporary or part-time appointments. This is necessary to give school managements the flexibility they need to plan their programmes and to cater for the broad range of subjects offered. It is also necessary to take account of the effect on the annual staffing allocation of short term fluctuation in student numbers.

Consequently, the authorities of community and comprehensive schools may not fill a teaching post in a permanent capacity without the prior approval of my Department. My Department, when considering applications for sanction to make permanent appointments, takes account of the curricular needs of the school, the flexibility required to meet these needs, the approved teacher allocation, the number of permanent teachers already on the staff and the enrolment trends.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - An Óige Funding.

Qst.hpid: Mr. J. O'Keeffe Mr. J. O'Keeffe
Qst.Quest: whether, in view of substantial State moneys made available to the An Óige Hostel Movement, an annual report is sought and furnished from An Óige; and whether any discussion takes place in relation to the development or otherwise of the movement and, in particular, in relation to any decisions involving the closure and sale of hostels such as the one in Kinsale, County Cork.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: My Department provides annual funding to An Óige under the youth service grant scheme in respect of core staff and day-to-day administration costs. In 1993, the grant was £91,000.
Under the conditions for this scheme, fully audited accounts and an annual report must be submitted to my Department by every youth organisation in receipt of funding including An Óige.

MainHeading.P: Officials from my Department meet representatives from youth organisations, including An Óige, on an ongoing basis. However, the closure or sale of any hostel is entirely a matter for An Óige in which my Department has no function and whose views are not required to be sought.

I understand that An Óige took its decision to close the Kinsale Hostel following a fire officer's report on the premises which in its view, would have cost a prohibitive sum to implement. I should mention in this regard that the youth service grant scheme does not permit the funding of capital works such as the renovation of hostels.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: Níl iarratas faighte ón mBord Bainistíochta ar deontas i leith oibreachta feabhais ag an scoil seo.
Má cuirtear iarratas faoi bhráid mo Roinne déanfar breithniú cuí ar an gceist.

Qst.hpid: Éamon Ó Cuív Éamon Ó Cuív
Qst.Quest: cén uair a ndéantar cinneadh ar an iarratas ó Scoil Náisiúnta an Chnoic i nGorumna ar dheontais le caoi a chur ar an gcóras leictreachais lochtach sa scoil sin.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: Tá iarratas faighte ag mo Roinn ar deontas i leith oibreacha leictreachais ag an scoil seo. Tá an t-iarratas á mheas agus cuirfear cinneadh in iúl d'údaráis na scoile ar ball.

Qst.hpid: Éamon Ó Cuív Éamon Ó Cuív
Qst.Quest: cén uair a íocfar deontas £850 leis na hÚ daráis i Scoil Náisiúnta Leitir Mealláin i leith obair atá déanta le ceithre bliana.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: Tá deontas ceadaithe ag mo Roinn i leith costas oibreacha feabhais riachtanacha ag Scoil Náisiúnta Leitir Mealláin, Contae na Gaillimhe. Tá formhór an deontais cuí íoctha agus íocfar an fuíll each nuair a bheidh an obair críochnaithe agus deimhnithe ag comhairleoirí proifisiúnta na Roinne.

Qst.Quest: the number and the names of the primary schools in County Leitrim in which a radon assessment or measurement has been made; when these assessments or measurements were made; the exact findings of these measurements in becquerels per cubic metre of air in each school; the names of the schools where the becquerels per cubic metre of the levels of radon were of such a nature as to require preventative action; the preventative action, if any, that has been taken or is planned and the names of the schools involved; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

the number and the names of the primary schools in County Sligo in which a radon assessment or measurement has been made; when the assessments or measurements were made; the exact findings of these measurements in becquerels per cubic metre of air in each school; the names of the schools where the becquerels per cubic metre of the levels of radon were of such a nature as to require preventative action; the preventative action, if any, that has been taken or is planned and the names of the schools involved; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

the counties in which radon assessment or measurements have been taken in the primary schools; whether there was any significant difference in the findings of these measurements in the primary schools in County Sligo and the primary schools in County Leitrim with the findings in other areas throughout the country; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: I propose to take Questions Nos. 622, 623 and 624 together.
Radon tests have not been carried out in primary schools in County Leitrim.

The results of an assessment in 1992 of 63 primary schools in County Sligo by the Radiological Institute of Ireland indicated 32 schools with radon levels above 150 becquerels per cubic metre. The institute recommended that work be carried out to reduce these levels.

Tenders were invited for mitigation work to 26 schools and chairpersons of the boards of management of the schools were recently advised to accept tenders in each case. Tenders will be invited shortly for the remaining 5 schools — one school has since closed. Work has been completed in 7 schools.
It would not be appropriate to identify the schools in question.

During 1990 and 1991 tests were carried out in 439 schools in counties Clare, Mayo and Galway. The level of radon exceeded 150 becquerels per square metre in 22 of these schools. The necessary mitigation work has been carried out in these cases.

Qst.hpid: Mr. Noonan (Limerick East) Mr. Noonan (Limerick East)
Qst.Quest: if she has received an application for funds from the national lottery for the upgrading of sporting facilities at a school (details supplied) in County Limerick; when funds will become available to her Department to consider applications; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: My Department has received an application for national lottery funding for the upgrading of sporting facilities at the school in question.

The national lottery funded recreational facilities scheme, administered by my Department, is generally confined to the assistance of voluntary community organisations in the provision of and improvements to recreational leisure and community facilities.
All applications received under this scheme will be considered as soon as possible in the context of the funding available in 1994.

Qst.Quest: if she will reinstate the transport service for children from the Aughrim/Glenalappa area of Moyvane, County Kerry, who are attending Murhur national school; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: In order to establish or retain a school transport service, there must be a sufficient number of children in a distinct locality to ensure that the average daily number of children eligible for free transport being conveyed each school term would not be less than ten. In this context, eligible children means children between 4 and 10 years of age who live not less than two miles from their nearest school, and, if over 10 years, not less than three miles.

While the number of eligible children offering for transport in the case to which the Deputy refers is no longer sufficient to warrant maintenance of the service, I am prepared, in the circumstances of the case, to have the service re-instated until the end of the current school term.

Qst.Quest: if she will grant student representation on the Board of Management in University College, Cork, in view of the fact that the students have not been represented on this body since June 1993.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: I will shortly be putting a proposal to Government to appoint a student representative to the Governing Body.

Qst.Quest: whether she has received an application from Confaí GAA Club, Leixlip, County Kildare, for national lottery funds towards the provision of amenities at the club grounds; if so, if she has studied the requirements; if she will favourably consider this request in an area where such facilities are required; if she will give a positive response in 1994; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: My Department has received an application from Confaí GAA Club, Leixlip, County Kildare for national lottery funding towards the development of their facilities.
All applications received under this scheme will be considered as soon as possible in the context of the funding available in 1994.

Qst.Quest: the full schedule of accommodation originally proposed in relation to Scoil Mhuire, Clane, County Kildare; if she intends to augment or reduce any part of the schedule concerned; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: Scoil Mhuire, Clane, County Kildare was built to cater for 650 pupils with the following schedule of accommodation: 10 general classrooms, 2 lecture rooms, 1 mathematics room, 1 language room and recording studio, 3 science laboratories and preparation areas, 1 demonstration room, 2 social studies rooms and project areas, 1 metalwork room and store, 1 building construction room, 1 mechanical drawing room, 1 double art/craft room and store, 1 home economics room, 1 dress design room, 1 commerce/business room, 1 commerce/ typing room, library and stores music/drama room, guidance area, religion area, general purposes/dining/ kitchenette, administration offices, staff accommodation, toilets, plant rooms, resource areas, stores, and circulation. A further three temporary classrooms were provided in 1987.
As the school is considered to have sufficient accommodation at present to cater for the demand for pupil places in the area, there are no proposals to provide additional accommodation.

Qst.Quest: whether she will award an M1 grant to a person (details supplied) in County Kildare, who is currently attending St. Patrick's College, Maynooth, County Kildare; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: Kildare County Council is the body statutorily entrusted with the administration of the higher education grants scheme in this case. I understand from the council that a full maintenance grant at the “adjacent” rate was awarded on the basis that, in accordance with the terms of the scheme, the person in question could reasonably be expected to travel daily between his normal family residence and the college. I also understand that the council is reviewing its decision in light of an appeal from the candidate in question.
I would refer the Deputy to the council for any further information he may require.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - County Kildare National Schools.

Qst.Quest: when the extra facilities required at Rathcoffey national school, County Kildare will be completed and ready for occupation; if such works will be completed in time for the 1994/1995 year; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

the extent of her communication with the authorities at Rathcoffey national school, County Kildare in the period 10 December 1993 to 26 January 1994; if she intends the immediate implementation of the subject matter of such discussions; the extent and time schedule of such proposals; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: I propose to take Questions Nos. 631 and 640 together.

I am pleased to say that my Department has recently informed the chairman of the board of management of Rathcoffey national school that the major building project for this school would be included in a phased programme for 1994 and that, subject to the completion of the necessary planning and tendering process, a contract for the project would be placed in the course of the year.

As all steps in the planning process are not within my Department's control it is not possible to say when the provision of these facilities will be completed. However, should there be any delay in placing the contract, this project will not lose its place in the priority listings.

Qst.Quest: the current position in regard to her proposals for the provision of national school facilities at Allen, County Kildare; whether this project will proceed in the current year; if works will be completed within a reasonable time; if the necessary finance is available to undertake this project in 1994; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

the extent of the proposals for the provision of a new school at Allen/Kilmeague national school, County Kildare in the period 1 December 1993 to 26 January 1994; if she intends the expenditure of the necessary funding to implement this project to be drawn down in 1994; the total anticipated expenditure in the current year; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: I propose to take Questions Nos. 632 and 639 together.

I am pleased to say that my Department has recently informed the chairman of the board of management of Allen national school that the major building project for this school would be included in a phased programme for 1994 and that, subject to the completion of the necessary planning and tendering process, a contract for the project would be placed in the course of the year.

As all steps in the planning process are not within my Department's control it is not possible to say when the provision of these facilities will be completed. Should there be any delay in placing the contract this project will not lose its place in the priority listings.
It is not possible to say at this stage what expenditure on this project will be incurred in the current year.

Qst.Quest: the current position regarding subvention to meet the full cost of school transport in the case of a person (details supplied) in County Kildare; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: My Department is actively engaged in seeking a solution which will meet the particular transport needs of the person in question. I will advise the Deputy of the outcome as soon as possible.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - County Kildare National Schools.

Qst.Quest: the amount, if any, in grant offered in respect of refurbishment, equipment, improvements or other such ancillary works at Kill national school, County Kildare in the past five years; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: Grants in the region of £44,000 have been paid over the past five years for refurbishment and equipment at Kill national school, County Kildare.

Qst.Quest: if she has received a copy of the INTO survey of schools currently deemed seriously sub-standard; if so, if she has noted the schools in County Kildare which are deemed to have fallen within this category; her proposals in each case to ensure that the standard and extent of accommodation is improved forthwith; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: I have received a copy of the INTO survey referred to by the Deputy and note that there is one school in County Kildare included on the list — Hewetson National School, Clane. I am pleased to inform the Deputy that the major building project at this school is included in the Primary School Capital Programme for 1994.
I would also add that two other major projects in County Kildare — Allen and Rathcoffey national schools are also included in 1994 capital programme.

Qst.Quest: the extent to which a person (details supplied) in County Kildare will qualify for a higher education grant in her capacity as a mature student in 1994, having completed her Leaving Certificate in 1988; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: I understand from Kildare County Council, which is the body statutorily entrusted with the administration of the higher education grants scheme in this case, that it has no record of receiving an application for a grant from the person in question. If the candidates submit a grant application, Kildare County Council will consider it in the usual way in accordance with the terms of the relevant scheme.

Qst.Quest: whether she has responded in full to the requests from Kildare vocational education committee and the authorities at Maynooth Post Primary School, County Kildare for extra facilities at the school; if she will give details of the schedule of proposed works and the anticipated timescale for implementation of these works as at 26 January 1994; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: My Department authorised County Kildare vocational education committee to have detailed drawings, specifications and tender documentation prepared for the following schedule of accommodation at this school: 3 general classrooms, 2 lecture rooms, 1 art/craft room and store, 1 mathematics room, toilet and circulation area.

The vocational education committee have recently sought approval for the inclusion of a number of additional facilities to the extension, including a link block office space and a boiler house. Their submission is currently being assessed and my Department will be in contact with the vocational education committee in due course.
This project is being considered for inclusion in the 1994 capital programme in the context of all the relevant building, educational and financial factors.

Qst.Quest: if her attention has been drawn to the urgent need for extra facilities at Scoil Dara, Kilcock, County Kildare; if she has or will agree on the schedule of extra facilities required at the school; when the extra permanent facilities will be available at the school, thus transferring students from present prefabricated classrooms; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: A request for additional accommodation has been received from Scoil Dara, Kilcock. The school has been asked to submit a formal application together with additional details in relation to its needs. On receipt of this information the school's requirements will be considered as a matter of urgency.
